column9: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen. Posts include statuses, photos, links, videos and more. (Unique Users)
column10: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen through unpaid distribution. (Unique Users)
column11: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen through paid distribution such as an ad. (Unique Users)
column12: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's post entered a person's screen. Posts include statuses, photos, links, videos and more. (Total Count)
column13: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's posts entered a person's screen through unpaid distribution. (Total Count)
column14: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's post entered a person's screen through paid distribution such as an ad. (Total Count)
column15: Lifetime: The number of unique people who engaged in certain ways with your Page post, for example by commenting on, liking, sharing, or clicking upon particular elements of the post. (Unique Users)
column16: Lifetime: The number of people who matched the audience targeting that clicked anywhere in your post on News Feed. (Unique Users)
column17: Lifetime: The number of clicks anywhere in your post on News Feed from the user that matched the audience targeting on it. (Total Count)
column18: Lifetime: The number of people who have given negative feedback to your post. (Unique Users)
column19: Lifetime: The number of times people have given negative feedback to your post. (Total Count)
column20: Lifetime: The number of impressions of your Page post to people who have liked your Page. (Total Count)
column21: Lifetime: The number of people who saw your Page post because they've liked your Page (Unique Users)
column22: Lifetime: The number of paid impressions of your Page post to people who have liked your Page. (Total Count)
column23: Lifetime: The number of people who like your Page and who saw your Page post in an ad or sponsored story. (Unique Users)
column24: Lifetime: The number of people who have liked your Page and clicked anywhere in your posts. (Unique Users)
column25: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length without any paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column26: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length without any paid promotion. (Total Count)
column27: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length after paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column28: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length after paid promotion. (Total Count)
column29: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed for more than 3 seconds without any paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column30: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed for more than 3 seconds without any paid promotion. (Total Count)
column31: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed more than 3 seconds after paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column32: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed more than 3 seconds after paid promotion. (Total Count)
column33: Lifetime: Average time video viewed (Total Count)
column34: Lifetime: Length of a video post (Total Count)
column35: Lifetime: The number of unique people who created a story about your Page post by interacting with it. (Unique Users)
column38: Lifetime: The number of stories created about your Page post, by action type. (Total Count)
column41: Lifetime: The number of people who matched the audience targeting on the post that clicked anywhere in the post on News Feed, by type. (Unique Users)
column44: Lifetime: The number of clicks anywhere in the post on News Feed from users that matched the audience targeting on the post, by type. (Total Count)
column47: Lifetime: The number of times people have given negative feedback to your post, by type. (Total Count)
column48: Lifetime: The number of people who have given negative feedback to your post, by type. (Unique Users)

column3:
"Late night ranks among the least diverse hours of TV, even though late-night programming tends to be the "edgiest" in broadcast TV history. Instead of promoting the latest macho blockbuster to be sold internationally, I wanted to use the format of the talk show to showcase Chicago's queer artists." - Aymar Jean Christian founder and Head of Development

Read on for more about the program and to watch the recap of last year's #OTVTonight. 

Save the date for this year's, coming up next Tuesday March 6th, at Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago.
Event page: In Progress: OTV | Open Television Tonight

The Roach is Coming - Trailer by Derrick Woods-Morrow.

In 2017 artist Derrick Woods-Morrow returned home to Greensboro, NC to reconnect with a police officer, who was once just another feral young boy on the playgrounds much like himself. Throughout a 72 hour period, they return to past moments of play, in an attempt to build a future where they could like they once were - two young boys, searching for each other, deep into the bushes, one white & one unaware of his blackness.

The Roach is Coming premieres March 30th at the The Art Institute of Chicago. 

#BlackHistoryMonth

Code-Switched is a comedy-drama series that follows the interconnected lives of five South Asian-American roommates and friends trying to blaze their own trails in a world of high-expectations, fleeting relationships, and gentrified workplaces. 

See the premiere of Code-Switched at In Progress: OTV | Open Television Tonight March 6th! 

Stay up to date with all of our premieres and events by signing up for the #OTVProgram weareo.tv/program

On the #weareOTV rebrand:
"With OTV we are dropping ‘beta’ and focusing on raising our production value, cultivating partners in distribution and exhibition, all while continuing to develop experimental, genre-defying works that expand the art of video narrative.” - founder and Head of Development Aymar Jean Christian for Cassius Mag

Don't forget to #savethedate for our kick-off of cycle 3, In Progress: OTV | Open Television Tonight March 6th at Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago!

#OTVTonight 

Sign up for the #OTVprogram and stay up to date with our premieres and events: weareo.tv/program

One of the #OTVOriginals we will be premiering in our #OTVWednesday series is VELVET. Catch their premiere at the Chicago Cultural Center 3/28 6-8pm.

When Demetra, a competitive professional, is forced to reevaluate her social life, she strikes up a friendship with Cymone, her seemingly much cooler coworker. As their worlds collide to form a brand new #squad, these five young Chicagoans begin to reevaluate their own identities as well as their relationships to each other. By weaving together public and private experiences, VELVET comedically explores the joys, vulnerabilities, and everything in-betweens of making new friends in your mid-twenties. 

VELVET is created by Allie Dunn, Leo J Gilbert, Dru Greenwood, Tyla Landry, Sydney Levison, Clifton Lyons, and Becky Schultz. 

Don't forget to save the date for In Progress: OTV | Open Television Tonight March 6th at the Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago. 

Sign up for the #OTVProgram to stay up to date with our premieres and events: weareo.tv/program

#BlackHistoryMonth
OTV - Open Television

Now presenting the trailer for #Yogma by Karla Huffman!

Yogma is about a hopeful, young yoga instructor who dreams of being a bright star in a beautiful culture finds out that her rise to the top, and the world shes fighting to be a part of... aren't exactly what she thought they'd be.

You can watch Yogma and an interview with creator, Karla Huffman, at In Progress: OTV | Open Television Tonight March 6th at Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago!

Stay up to date by signing up for the #OTVProgram: weareo.tv/program

Now presenting: the official trailer for Seeds!

#Seedsseries is a comedic, socially conscious web series from Deja Harrell, following the misadventures of four young black women. 

You can see the premiere of Seeds at In Progress: OTV | Open Television Tonight at the Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago on March 6th! Make sure to RSVP. 

#BlackHistoryMonth

It's still #BlackHistoryMonth y'all. THE BLACKEST BLACKITY BLACK SHOUT OUT to #BlackPanther and the fam that supported and destroyed the box office projections, raking in $361 million globally in its opening weekend. Again, proving what we all BEEN saying-- people want intersectional art. #WakandaForever

In case you missed it, last week we debuted our trailer for the third cycle with all new #OTVPresents and #OTVOriginals! Keep supporting intersectional artists and #savethedate for #OTVTonight March 6th: In Progress: OTV | Open Television Tonight which kicks off our season of premieres at the Chicago Cultural Center.
Kate Royal, creator and writer of #InRealLife, will debut a new play as a reading tomorrow at the Den Theatre!

"Chicago artists do it for the love. We do it for the passion. We do it because it makes us who we are. And that’s so cool. Nowadays, so much is about status and money, but in Chicago people are still being creative and ego-less. It’s very beautiful to see." - Brandon Markell Holmes
OTV - Open Television
OTV - Open Television updated their website address.

Happy Valentine's Day to all of y'all. Live your best life today and always. Shout out to #opentvcommunity fam Aasia LaShay Bullock for this 🔥🔥🔥

See more of her brilliance in her web series #StarvingArtists co-created with Dewayne Perkins here: https://vimeo.com/channels/starvingartists.

Keep up with our news and premieres here: weareopen.tv/program
#BlackHistoryMonth

#BlackHistoryMonth spotlight on M Shelly Conner:

When Shelly's not working on Quare Life Web Series - premiering this cycle!- she runs Quare Square. Quare Square is a collective of black queer creatives in Chicago, and Quare Square Open Mic, a weekly night of stand up and other artists at The Jeffery Pub in South Shore.

Watch the trailer for Quare Life here, written by M Shelly Conner, directed by Jessica King of King is a Fink Productions: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EBJf9Nh16E4

Happy #blackhistorymonth, this week we are shining a spotlight on some of our brilliant black artists in the #opentvcommunity. 

M Shelly Conner is a Chicago-based writer, scholar and humorist. She is the executive director of Quare Square Inc., a nonprofit for queer artists of color and the curator of the dapper queer lifestyle website DapperVista.com. She is also the creator of Quare Life Web Series which will premiere on Open TV - beta this cycle! 

#QuareLife revolves around Michelle Jones who is living the Black American dream. She has a nice home, a girlfriend, and a foot on the rung of professional ascension. When her marriage proposal is rejected and work contract ends, Michelle must rely on her close friends, twin brother, and formerly homophobic mother for support.

Happy #blackhistorymonth. As we gear up for our 3rd cycle, we are shining a spotlight on some of our brilliant black artists in the #opentvcommunity. 

Rashi Bey is a Transdisciplinary Artist,  Intimacy Coach, Motivational Speaker & Writer. She is the Creator, Executive Producer, and Lead Actor in "Let Go and Let God"

"This film is dedicated to people who are struggling with the grips of depression and wondering if there is a way out. In Let Go and Let God she finds her release through dance. The movement stirs her soul to the point where it brings her back to life and she makes a commitment to live again, to take back her power and move forward walking in the joy that God intended her to have for her life" -- Rashida KhanBey

Hear about our releases and events first by signing up for the #opentvprogram: weareopen.tv/program

As we gear up for our third cycle of premieres, we are shining a light on some of our brilliant black artists in honor of #BlackHistoryMonth. 

Rashi Bey, Transdisciplinary Artist,  Intimacy Coach, Motivational Speaker & Writer, is on a mission to help women rediscover radical body love, shameless & passionate sex and visceral forgiveness in their intimate relationships.

Rashida is the Creator, Executive Producer & Lead Actor in micro films "Let Go & Let God" produced by Open TV - beta and "Sex Is A God Thing" produced by Woman Untamed with Rashida Khanbey (Rashida's Chicago based Film/TV Production Co)., Her 2014 film "Sex Is A God Thing" has now accumulated over 10 million views across all social media platforms. Production for the "Sex Is A God Thing" web series began earlier this month in Chicago in collaboration with Open TV.

Happy #blackhistorymonth, this week we are shining a spotlight on some of our brilliant black artists in the #opentvcommunity. 

Before Brown Girls, director Samantha Bailey created and stars in You're So Talented , a series that follows Bea, (played by Bailey) an out of work Chicago artist, as she navigates her twenties and its inevitable dramas. YST has two full seasons, you can watch all of them below! 

Hear about our releases and events first by signing up for the #opentvprogram: weareopen.tv/program

Happy #BlackHistoryMonth, this week we are shining a spotlight on some of our brilliant black artists in the #opentvcommunity.

Samantha Bailey is a writer and director from Chicago, currently living in LA. She created and starred in You're So Talented, a Gotham Independent Film Awards nominated web series. She also co-created and directed the break-out hit and Emmy nominated web series Brown Girls which has been picked up by HBO! You can watch both shows here: 

https://vimeo.com/channels/browngirls
https://vimeo.com/channels/youresotalented

#femalefilmmakerfriday

"Cunt is my black queer gender non-conforming femininity oozing from my pores. It is me stacking claim to my independence. I also practice a type of vogue femme which is called soft + cunt. A slower sensual style that is powerfully seductive + playful." - from the #opentvspotlight on NIC Kay

Watch the #bronxcunttour chronicling their tour of #lilBLK their one-person show. 

#BlackHistoryMonth

Happy #BlackHistoryMonth, this week we are shining a spotlight on some of our brilliant black artists in the #opentvcommunity. 

NIC Kay is an artist and mover hailing from the Bronx, who occupies many liminal spaces. 

"I made lil BLK to talk to my younger self aka NICKY. I wanted her (she likes feminine pronouns) to know that I loved her and that she was finally gonna get the audience and applause she worked so hard for. The little black girl who felt too small to be as great as her wildest dreams." 

Watch Nic Kay's #bronxcunttour, which chronicles their first #lilblk tour here: http://www.weareopen.tv/open-tv-originals/thebronxcunttour

Hear about our releases and events first by signing up for the #opentvprogram: weareopen.tv/program

Happy #BlackHistoryMonth, this week we are shining a spotlight on some of our brilliant black artists in the #opentvcommunity. 

Artist, Rashayla Marie Brown, on the inspiration for her anti-reality series "Reality is not Good Enough":

"I was very intrigued by the idea of making a reality inspired show that didn't really make a lot of sense or disrupted our typical notions of how that show should go, especially one featuring an all-Black female cast. I became more interested over time in trying to create a sense of connectedness to the people behind the camera, perhaps even more than the ones in front of it."

Hear news of our premieres and events first by signing up for the #opentvprogram - weareopen.tv/program

Happy #BlackHistoryMonth, this week we are shining a spotlight on some of our brilliant black artists in the #opentvcommunity. 

Rashayla Marie Brown is a performance artist, director, and filmmaker whose in-progress anti-reality series, "Reality is Not Good Enough" appeared in the #OpenTVPresents collection. 

Beyond a parody, this is an investigation of the concept of the gaze and the trouble with being an independent filmmaker. The cast are allowed to critique the editing process.

Hear about our upcoming premieres and events first, by signing up for the #opentvprogram weareopen.tv/program

See Queen Saya Naomi's acting debut here in #NupitaObama. Her character "Gia" is directly based off of Saya herself and was the inspiration for #SerialDreamer, our forthcoming spring pilot. 

Nupita Obama is the alter ego of Curtis (Mister Wallace), cast out of her relationship with Reyes (Kiam Marcelo Junio), because their new lover, Gia (Saya Naomi), is moving in and Curtis can’t afford to move out. Curtis creates Nupita to diffuse the tension.

Saya Naomi performed a version of her drag persona, but also did makeup and styling. "Vogua" demonstrates how much "production value" queer artists of color can bring to television.

#blackhistorymonth

Happy #BlackHistoryMonth, this week we are shining a spotlight on some of our brilliant black artists in the #opentvcommunity. 

Meet original Drag Artist, Queen Saya Naomi. You can see the "Bad Girl of Halsted" performing in New York and Chicago and alongside Mister Wallace and Kiam Marcelo Junio in #opentvoriginal, Nupita Obama. 

"Gia" who Saya Naomi plays in Nupita Obama, is directly based off of Saya in real life! Serial Dreamer, our newest pilot set to be released this spring, is a continuation of Gia's story. 

In this video, see how Queen Saya Naomi was born, and how she got her start in drag and acting.

Happy #blackhistorymonth, this week we are shining a spotlight on some of our brilliant black artists in the #opentvcommunity.

Erik Lamar Wallace II or Mister Wallace’s first Open TV project was our very first as well, Nupita Obama Creates Vogua. The series was written and directed by Open TV founder Aymar Jean Christian. Erik returns to the screen this spring in #SerialDreamer, Open TV's newest pilot.

Erik is a rapper, DJ, and performance artist queering hip-hop in ways we've never seen, all while co-running a queer indie label, Futurehood spotlighting a diverse group of artists. Get to know them:

"We write laws, we extinguish memories to make you blacks, browns, natives, bitches and faggots the monsters of mythology." - Adam Smythe (Aaron Rustebakke), the head of the New World Colonizers.

A strong opener to the season finale of Brujos, yet another truth embedded in the highly allegorical supernatural show. The Brujxs are all finally united, will they beat The Scientists? Will they succeed in dismantling white supremacy? Stay tuned. 

#BrujosTV #opentvrewind

The Brujos coven continues to grow across gender and color lines. Enter Coco (Sean James William Parris) Selene  (Mia Vivens),  Vasquez (Avi Roque),Ahmet (Masood Muhammad Haque), and Ryan (James Park). Though they may not like each other, their survival depends on their cooperation. 

"What I guess the show is about a kind of a fairy tale or allegory and part-handbook of how we can all get free. And how we are implicated in each other’s liberation.” - creator Ricardo Gamboa 

#BrujosTV #opentvrewind

As the Brujos' hope wanes, in their desperation, they seek outside counsel. Some, in the form of mentorship, others in the form of more complex magic. 

#BrujosTV #opentvrewind 

Be the first to hear about our premieres and events by signing up for the #opentvprogram weareopen.tv/program

It finally comes to blows for the Brujos as they face off with the New World Colonizers and as pressure mounts, they begin to take their pain out on each other. 

#Brujostv #opentvrewind 

Be the first to hear about our premieres and events by signing up for the #opentvprogram weareopen.tv/program

Happy #BlackHistoryMonth fam. In this episode of #BrujosTV the New World Colonizers are closing in and violence is hitting close to the brujos. Here we see the different ways they are dealing with the trauma, and not all the ways are healthy. 

Writer Ricardo Gamboa on the newest brujo:
"The young boy that appears, played by Victor Krazi Musoni, who’s a sleep talker—that was influenced by a young autistic boy that disappeared when I first moved to New York, and further motivated by the Laquan McDonald shooting and the shooting of black men that were happening around the country."

#opentvrewind #BHM
